column4: reboot, hit escape when it prompts you, choose 'recovery mode'
copy the root line, swap 'root' with your user name
your user is not in sudoers, right?
mercurus: I am in recover mode and at a root@alanhod: prompt
mercurus: visudo presented me with a screen that I knew nothing about.
you changed your user's home directory?
what's on the disk at the moment?
At the moment, there are three fat32 partitions. one ext3 partition and 80 gig of unusable space.

In all partitioning tools I throw at it. It was created after I had used qtparted from System_rescueCD to create more space on a 120 reiserfs partition only to learn later that qtparted has problems with reiserfs. Have I lost this space forever?
i doubt it, but it seems strange.
perhaps one partition was created incorrectly.
